answers.answer: When fasting my sugars are never at 90 and she did have me on medication but took me off because my sugar was dropping to almost the 40s

I have this but I am not sure about the numbers. Alot of it is controlled by a low carb diet to help maintain lower sugar levels so they don't spike. I am not currently on a medication but I do check my blood 4 times a day and aim to keep it below 120.
I check mine everyday 3 times a day. I mostly keep mine below 110 but today I ate a parfait and it spiked.
I know my midwife says 90-120 is where she likes it to be anything higher then that she doesn't want, I test 4 times a day
Yeah my doctor says that too. They don't spike like this much like I said it's only happened a few times. But I don't want to be labeled a bad parent because I can't control this lol
My doctor liked me to be under 130 but about 2-3 times a week it'd be high she wasn't concerned
Okay my doctor wasnt really worried about the 158 because I went walking I'm just worried if they spike anymore will I be in danger is my main consurn
You should be fine just make sure you walk around the time it's usually higher. Once in awhile shouldn't hurt
Yeah I tell my self everything is okay but my anxiety is getting the best of me.

question: Okay so the week before last I went to my doctor and she checked my blood sugar thing and was happy about my sugars. Well I told her my sugar did spike up to 150 something but explained that I went walking and it went down to like 90. She saw it on the tester thing so she knew I wasn't lying. Well tonight it went up to 136. It was raining and I couldn't go walking. So I'm wondering what is considered uncontrolled GD? I've been doing really good and since the 150 something spike my sugars haven't been over 100.
title: when is gestational diabetes considered uncontrolled?
